reviews.title: Terrific Situation with tram stop 75 metres away
reviews.text: Just returned from 3 lovely days in the Prague snow.

reviews.title: Not in the centre
reviews.text: Friendly staff, courteous and multi-lingual, the hotel is tastefully designed and the breakfasts hit the spot.

reviews.title: BW Kinsky Gardens - Great Hotel
reviews.text: We had a great time in Prague and I think down to two things. The city and the hotel. Many people say "You only sleep there, so it's not that important". Everyone is entitled to their own opinion but I think it does matter.

This relatively small hotel is literally just a 5 minute walk from Charles Bridge and the main City Centre. It's on a quiet street by Prague's standards. The rooms were absolutely spotless as were the bathrooms. The rooms were some of the cleanest I had been in in Europe. The hotel was nicely decorated and appeard to be run efficiently.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel.

reviews.text: The breakfast was great with an abundance of choice. Let's face it you don't eat that much normally at home so there is a limit to how much you want to eat at that time of the morning, but staff were both friendly and courteous.
reviews.title: Relaxed hotel with good transport links
Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: It's not 5 Star but then for the money it was outstanding.

reviews.title: A Lovely Hotel!
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from 10 days in Prague. We selected the BW Kinsky Garden after reading the reviews here and viewing their web site. We spent so long in Prague because our daughter has moved there to teach english. So it was a vacation and family visit. Otherwise I'm thinking about 3-4 days in Prague would be plenty to see most of the major attractions.

This was a nice hotel, a little bit of a hike from the old town square, about a mile to a mile and a half. There are trolleys, but we usually walked. The buffet breakfast was very good, included in room price. The room we had was pretty small, and there was no A/C, not much of a problem in October, but the open window brought a little street noise in. The hotel has a contract with a taxi service, which we used to go to the airport, to avoid the problem issue of Czech cabs. There was an outstanding little mexican restaurant on the way walking to old town, just before the Subway Resaturant. I would probably stay at another hotel closer to the action and get a bigger room, we had our 13 month old daughter, so the hotel provided crib took up some space.
reviews.title: Nice, but not spectacular

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Best Western Premier Kinsky Garden for three nights in early November, and would happily go back again. The hotel is not in the center of town--it's south of Mala Strana Square on the left side of the river--but is easily reached by taking Tram 12 to the Svandovo stop, then walking one block up the hill, across from the park. We booked our room through the Best Western web site for 95 Euro a night including breakfast, and were given a very nice, high-ceilinged room at the front of the hotel. But because we thought it would be noisy at night since the hotel is on a busy street, we asked to move, and were given a slightly smaller but still nice room at the back of the hotel. No view, but we could open the window in the evening to keep cool and it was still very quiet.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
Just average
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and offered suggestions for sightseeing, etc., and when we needed to buy a few odds and ends they pointed us toward a large, modern shopping center about four blocks south of the hotel, with an impressive array of restaurants and shops. The hotel made a good base for sightseeing, as the tram system took us anywhere we wanted easily (we had bought a three-day transport system pass at the Prague train station when we first arrived).

reviews.title: Good Hotel in a wonderful City
reviews.text: The hotel arranged for a taxi to take us to the airport when we left (for a fixed fare of 600 crowns), and our only surprise was that there was a place on the bill for a tip when we checked out. We left a small amount, but wondered if that is a common practice.

I stayed at this hotel because of many favorable reviews in this web site, but I was somewhat disappointed with the overall stay. The room is too small and the staff was not very helpful when I wanted to extend the stay for one more night. Basically I was told that the hotel was fully booked and to look somwhere else. I did and found the Ibis just 2 blocks awaz. Despite being a 2-star hotel, I felt better there than at the Kinsky - which is not a 4 star hotel as their web site says.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel & staff
